section.title: Collecting messages from the systemd-journal system log storage
section.para: The systemd-journal() source collects messages directly from the journal of platforms that use systemd. If you use the systemd-journal() source directly (instead of using the system() source), make sure that your other &abbrev; sourcer do not read from /dev/kmsg or /proc/kmsg to avoid duplicating log messages. (The messages from /dev/kmsg or /proc/kmsg are automatically available in the journal as well.)

example.title: Sending all fields through syslog protocol using the systemd-journal() driver
example.para: To send all fields through the syslog protocol, enter the prefix in the following format: ".SDATA.<name>".

section.title: systemd-journal() source options
section.para: The systemd-journal() driver has the following options:

simplesect.title: default-facility()
simplesect.para: Description: The default facility value if the SYSLOG_FACILITY entry does not exist.

simplesect.title: default-level()
simplesect.para: Description: The default level value if the PRIORITY entry does not exist.

simplesect.title: max-field-size()
simplesect.para: Description: The maximum length of a field's value.

simplesect.title: prefix()
simplesect.para: Description: If this option is set, every non-built-in mapped names get a prefix (for example: ".SDATA.journald.").
